question: Waiting for us
answer: How in hell could they have known we were coming?

question: How in hell do I know?
answer: Where do we go?

question: You hear me, Pike? -- I said it ain't fair... Pike stands,. flips the knife into the ground, faces the brothers.
answer: Well,..why don't you answer me, you dapnned yellow.-livered trash? The brothers fide, et., look at each other.

question: Ah.--' Pike, you know...
answer: I don't know a damned thing except I either lead this bunch or I end it -- right now;

question: You can saddle up or shut up -- take your choice --
answer: "What will he do?

question: That's what I have to figure.
answer: Maybe they'll split up.

question: Why in the hell, did you ever quit it?
answer: Why in hell are you still goin'?

question: I don.'t know"any better -- maybe don't want any better, Hell, I wouldn't know what to do with 'better' if it poked me.in the eye with a sharp stick.
answer: You -never gave it :a chance9 Pike. You got a halfway hard mouth, partner.

question: What in hell do you want me to-say ,-?
answer: Just don't give me, no lectures.. They are silent -- finally: Back off to what? Any real ideas for a next one? Pike closes his eyes and leans back.

question: Pershing. has. got men spread over the whole border. Everyone of those garrisons is going to be.gptting payroll.
answer: That kind of information is kind of. rough to come by.

question: You must have hurt that railroad pretty bad -- they spent a lot of time and money getting that ambush set up for us.
answer: Well, I caught up to them -- two or three times -- There was a man named Harrigan -- He had a certain way of doing things -- So I made him change his ways -- when you do that to a narrow man -- he can't live with it - from then on he's got to change you -- break you -- just to prove he's.right -- there-'s a hell of a lot of people, Dutch -- that just can't stand to be wrong.

question: Pride, I guess
answer: I guess -- but they can't ever forget it -- that pride that being wrong or learn by it.

question: Were about two hours from the Santa Caterinas. He turns and rides toward the mountains, the men following.
answer: That was a mighty fine talk you gave the boys 'bout stickin' to- gether. (as Pike doesn't That Gorch was near killin' me or me him --

question: We started together -- we'll end it together.
answer: By God, that's the way I see it -- that's the way it's always been with me...Sorry 'bout Deke - never figured him that way, Back in. San. Rafael -- my boy how' d. he do? They ride for a while in silence as

question: Your boy2
answer: C.L. -- Clarence Lee -- my daughter's boy ---not too bright, but a good boy -- He handle higself all right? -- I told him -- you do -- just what Mister Bishop says -- Did he conduct hisself well?

question: He did fine --
answer: Well, you had enough on your mind He had to pull his weight just like the rest of us -- just wanted to know he didn't let you down -- run. when things got hot --

question: That culvert -- good place for them ----to make an ambush.
answer: Go on - ride up and find out. Coffer hesitates, his -ayes wide with fear. Thornton draws his gun, pulls back the hammer. Next time I want advice from any of you scum I'll ask for it -- until then, keep . your mouths shut and do what y-ou' re to ld%

question: All clear"'-- From here on, its Mexico, Mr, Thornton.
answer: What's the closest town of any size2 What's in Agua Verde?

question: Mexicans -- what else. Headquarters for Huerta regulars. fighting Obregon, led by an old time bandit named Mapache. Thornton thinks about this, then mounts and rides back in the direction they have come from. Don't-we follow?
answer: No -- we wait. 'Twenty-eight days.

question: May he die the death of a thousand traitors. , My village is up there ...in those mountains.
answer: So --?

question: I wish to visit my f amily...I can do it and meet you in Agua Verde a day of ter you get there.
answer: How?

question: Hard to believe.
answer: Not so hard -- we all dream of being a-child again -- even the worst of us -- perhaps the worst most of all..

question: You know us, then --
answer: I know myself only -- where I have been, what I have done.

question: Like to ride with us, old man? And for a moment, the old man's eyes flash as he watches
answer: -- I am too old. (almost cursing, indicating

question: -- I am too old. (almost cursing, indicating
answer: Hell, you ain't so old; partner.

question: They were many -- who shot -- your father resisted like a man and died like a man -- names in this matter have no importance. I killed one; I lie -- I ran --
answer: Joe --'by God I like you. I like a man who tells the truth.

question: Gone. No -- she went with them because she wished to. She became the woman of Mapache -- and others -- she went with them laughing -- Drunk with wine and love. Angel, knowing it's true, turns and moves away. Pike looks after him.' To him she was a goddess. To be wor- shipped from afar -- with music and flowers -- a deity to be followed and adored at a dis -nee but Mapache -' knew she was a mango -- ripe and waiting...
answer: -So Angel lives with a dream -- while Mapache eats the mango --

question: Just so -
answer: Many times -- and with the mango too. I never could carry a candle to you, old timer.

question: And. which do you prefer, the dream or the taste?
answer: I dream when I sleep -- and eat when I'm hungry.

question: And you want to gamble everything this one shipment will be attacked?!
answer: If they're in Agua Verde that's what - --they'll go for.

question: If?! Why not Juarez?
answer: Because we would have heard::. If they are in Agua Verde they will have seen Mapache. A killer for Huerta who calls himself a.general.-- with enough guns he can become a power in northern Mexico - my guess is Pike will try and get them f or  him.

question: The train will be guarded by regular troops!!
answer: Not regulars --.green recruits and not. worth a damn! I'll need twenty trained men -- not recruits or this gutter trash you.'ve given me.

question: I met a woman I wanted to marry... Pike 'grins a little at what now seems an absurd thought. Buenas no the s mi amor. Aurora swings and catches him full handed across the face9 the groceries scatter on the floor -- Pike bounces off the wall,. looks at her, tries to grin. Your husband due back?

No! He picks up a pan with a hot handle, drops it, spilling hot stew or soup on his foot, hops around cursing looking at the shambles on the stove and on the floor.' 236DD AURORA STANDS LOOKING AT HIM WITH LOVE, then smiling softly crosses to the side-board and pours him a drink. He takes it, suddenly both are laughing.

I.coming,..We are friends... all of us...I bring love and affection from el general -- We are comrades -- you and he -- all of us. 365 PIKE, DUTCH AND THE OTHERS watch silently as he rides up to the wagon. 366 HERRERA STOPS AND REMOVES HIS HAT', smiles, looks at. the heavily loaded wagon. Que bueno -- What bravery you. have.to have done this magnifi cent act for the liberty of Mexico. Angel laughs, spits, Herrera.looks at him for a moment, smiles, shrugs, turns to Pike. I am to escort you to the general. 367 NOBODY ANSWERS AND NONE OF THE GUNS pointed at him are lowered, he seems undisturbed. Tell me what is you wish?
answer: Tell him to-come closer!

question: .It'll take us a day to find him if he is -- if he isn't, he's holding a gun on us right now. 438 THE IAN TENSE,-THEIR WEAPONS coming up. We'll go after the others.
